entries.meaning: (telecommunications) Receiving on one frequency band and transmitting on another.
(textiles, of a twist) Left-handed or "S shaped", with individual fibers oriented down and to the right when the thread, yarn, or rope is vertical.

definitionGroups.group: A band going across something, especially:

entries.meaning: A layer of plywood with its grain at a right angle to the wood next to it.
(biology) A band or stripe perpendicular to the body of an animal.
A strip (of leather, metal, or some other material) going across a helmet or hat, or a helmet made with such a strip.

verbs.description: crossband (third-person singular simple present crossbands, present participle crossbanding, simple past and past participle crossbanded)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To arrange the layers of plywood so as to make their grains cross at right angles.
